msbt.message: The other day I was supposed to meet up with , but never showed up.Of course, I was a little late myself

I was working out—had a great rhythm going—and kept thinking, "Just one more set!"Before I knew it, our meet-up time had come and gone, !I ran over to meet my bud, but I was too late<10_4 /> Huh. Now that I think about it, yeah, totally my fault.

All was forgiven once I apologized. I mean, it really was my bad.I would never admit this, but I was late because I spent too much time admiring my muscles in the mirror Uh You didn't hear that, did you?!

Right when I was about to head out, this famous bodybuilder came on TVI got totally drawn in to the show, and before I knew it, my meet-up time had come and goneBut the voice on the TV kept on saying"If you've got dumbbells, you can do anything!"So I went to apologize, dumbbells in both hands, butit didn't go well
I'm going to teach you a training program I designed just for you!

It's called The Extreme Digging Workout!This technique basically involves flexing your biceps and digging like there's no tomorrow, .Oh! If you get carried away digging, we'll end up with holes all over the place. Don't forget to fill 'em in!
It's calledShaking Trees, -Style!This workout basically involves flexing your pecs while shaking trees all over the island. And if you shake up any wasps, you can get some good cardio too.
It's called Fishing Rod Training with !It basically involves vigorously flexing your lats while swinging a fishing rod around. At the advanced level, you might even catch a fish too, !

It's my patent-pending "Seem Interested In Anything" workout!First, you gotta bulk up those eyebrows. Remember, raised eyebrows are interested eyebrows!Next, nod once in a while. Work those neck muscles with some head tilts and some yes motions.Alright, that should get you started. Work on those, and I'll tell you about the rest later, !
I thought of a good way to spread the word about the awesome power of muscle fitness.

Two words<10_4 />muscle festival! Or I guess it could be one word if we go with "Musclefest." Either wayIt'll start and end with muscles, and I'll be the festival chairman. I need to work on my opening remarks"Welcome to Musclefest, everyone! I'm so happy you're here, and your muscles will be happy too!" "Now, everyone drop and give me one jillion push-ups and sit-ups! !"Sounds fun, right, ?

Two words<10_4 />muscle diary!See, I'll write in my muscle notebook every day, tracking my progress, giving myself advice, that kinda stuff. Then I'll self-publish my diary and share it with the world. And the best part isThe more I write, the heavier it gets! It's the gift that keeps you lifting!<10_4 /> Unless you read it electronically

Two words<10_4 />strength consulting! Folks can ask me questions about strength-training techniques. I'll stand around and flex and talk to folks about muscles. And the best part isI do that anyway! Woo! Get your free muscle advice right here, !
This is a little random, but guess which muscles I'm focusing on today.
Biceps.
Triceps.
Quads.
Hamstrings.
Calves.

Yes! Right answer! I knew you'd know.When I'm trying to get from a tree, Buster never fails me.Oh! Sorry "Buster" is my name for my favorite bicep, ."When Buster gets down to business, not a single shall remain unplucked!" That's my motto.

How did you know?! You are really sharp!When I'm digging a hole with a shovel, ol' Dusty really goes to work.Oh! Sorry "Dusty" is my name for my favorite tricep.When Dusty's in good shape, I can pull myself out of a hole super quick whenever I fall in one, !

Huh? How did you know? I mean, I guess it's pretty obvious because of how bulgy my quads are.Whenever I go for a walk, the Ripleys are always right there with me.Oh! Sorry I call my quads "the Ripleys." They're like family.Looks like me and the Ripleys have made quite an impression on you, !

Oh! You nailed it! I guess my efforts have paid off if you can tell just by looking.Yeah, the Hammond twins have been my lifelong running partners.Oh! Sorry I call my hamstrings "the Hammond twins."We work hard and we play hard.<10_4 /> And it looks like all our effort is really paying off, !

That's right! I guess the results of all our training are super obvious.This Calvin guy is small, but he's no slacker when it comes to working outOh! Sorry "Calvin" is my name for my favorite calf muscle.Don't ask which one is Calvin, 'cause then Clyde will get mad, and you do NOT want Clyde to get mad.Seriously, .
Did you know strength training is actually a deeply spiritual and, um, brainial activity, ?

When you focus on a muscle group, you know those muscles are gonna be sore. But you do it anyway, and that gives you mental toughness.And once you start looking forward to that soreness, you'll be my spiritual bud, !
I'm always consulting my muscles to see what's on the day's training menu so there's no wasted motion.Muscles speak in mental and spiritual ways.So listen to your muscles. They have a lot to say, .

When you know you trained hard, you get a ton of confidence. That's the best part of muscle soreness! The most positive outlook on stuff is never far.Paths to good mental and spiritual health are hidden everywhere in strength training, !
I keep going back and forth on whether I wanna become a sports staror a superhero.

Oh, wait. I'm pretty sure everyone on has seen my abs.And there's no way my costume's NOT gonna have an ab windowWhich means my abs would give away my secret identity OK, that answers that. Sports star it is.

I mean, I've got AMAZING agility, which means I should definitely be a sports star, right?Oh! Except the talent scouts are gonna be all over meAnd there's just no way I could ever pick between and Yeah, being a superhero is totally the way to go, !
Hang on! I don't have to decide at all, !If I become a sports star and win the championship, everyone will call me a superhero! That'll be easy!
Yeah, I'm pretty strong and fit, but lemme tell ya—I got NOTHIN' on some of the critters around here.

Like, have you ever seen a horseshoe crab flipped over on its back, ? They can flip themselves back over! Do you know how much core strength that takes?I've spent hours watching them scuttle along, trying to catch 'em doing a workout so I can copy it.

One time I was following a snapping turtle around, just curious about where it would go When all of a sudden it reared back and went SHAAAA!<10_4 /> Like it was saying, "Back off, buddy!"I didn't want any of that turtle heat, so I sprinted home. Set a new 10K PR on the way!

Once, I was trying to catch a tarantula when it reared back suddenly and started chasing me!I must have sprinted around the whole island three times in less than 15 minutes. Best race of my life! I high-fived all eight of its legs afterward.
You know My muscles are big enough to admit that my training hasn't been as effective lately.That's why I decided to turn "regular" activities into a chance to pump, !
Eating, for example. I tried to chew as fast as possible to target my face muscles!The only gain I got from that was an upset tummy and a sore jaw. Back to the drawing board, I guess

Writing, for example. I thought I could build up my finger muscles by writing letters with a weighted pen.It was great! The only problem was that every word was illegible. Can't win 'em all, you know?
Sleeping, for example. All that wasted time! Seemed like a great opportunity to fit in some sit-ups.It was going great at first. I hit a new record of 3,000 in one go! Then I had to go and wake up.
